sentences: Mere on k천ige suurem veekogu meie planeedil.
Lapsed m채ngisid rannas ja vaatasid merd.
P채rast pikka reisi n채gi ta merd esimest korda.
context: The word 'mere' in Estonian is the genitive singular form of 'meri', which means 'sea'. It indicates possession or relationship to the sea. In English, this would translate to 'of the sea' or simply convey that something belongs to or relates to the sea.
